channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Uneven road surface Hatherly Lane.lamp 34 opposite Wade Lane need resufacing, 18th June
item.description:
Hazard of uneven road causing loss of speed and direction just before new traffic bollard. Direction of travel towards Asda. Note there seems to be no traffic sign on the approach to the traffic keep left signs now on the road. Oncomming Traffic moves over to your side of the road!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle and Walking path with long wide crack in tarmac., 18th June
item.description:
Hazard to cycle wheels getting caught in the 'groove' created by the cracking tarmac. Location is at T junction of Runnymead with Up Hatherley Way. Travelling towards Chargrove Lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Up Hatherley Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 18th June
item.description:
Customer has called as there is some form of dispute between STW and their contractor in respect of completing works at the location. They understand that the contractor has indicated Highways are responsible somewhere in the process and query what's happening. Feedback requested.

item.title: Grass verges STILL not being cut, 17th June
item.description:
Outside 34 Abbotswood road. The grass cutters were in the area today but still did not cut our verges. In fact they have not been cut this year since Gloucester County Council took over grass cutting responsibility from Tewkesbury Council. A previous report stated that this problem had been resolved which is totally incorrect.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbotswood Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
